FILE: cm002625v11.0.txt
DYAD: USA - SUDAN
RIVALRY: RIV84
DISPUTE(S): MID4217 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190526
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190526

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4217 

TERRMID: MID4217 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4217 from cm narrative, the US bombed a suspected chemical weapons plant in Khartoum, killing one individual. Sudan protested, and subsequent investigations cast doubt on the US asserting that this was a chemical weapons plant. Occurred 8/20/1998. Coded not territorial because the US and Sudan did not contest a boundary.

TERRLINK: MID4217 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4217 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4217 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4217 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID4217 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4217 This MID concerns US retaliation for embassy bombings. From cm narrative and Gibler 2018, al Qaeda bombed US embassies in Kenya and Tanzania. In response, the US bombed a factory in Sudan and a target in Afghanistan. Coded civil war link because this was connected to rebel-associated violence (the al Qaeda bombing in Kenya and Tanzania) outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4217 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4217 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4217 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4217
rivalry=2625 nationa=USA nationb=SUDAN MID4217 19980820 -19980820 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

On August 20, 1998 the United States launched a cruise missile attack against a suspected chemical weapons plant in Khartoum, Sudan. This attack was in retaliation for the August 7 bombings of US embassies in Tanzania and Keyna. The Sudanese protested the attack, and subsequent investigation cast doubt on the assertion that this was a chemical weapons plant. First day and last day of dispute was on 8/20/1998.

NARRATIVE-CM:
Sudan and the US resumed diplomatic relations on July 25, 1972. US military forces attacked and destroyed a pharmaceutical factory in Khartoum on August 20, 1998, resulting in the death of one individual.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Associated Press* (AP), August 26, 1998; *Keesing*, August 12-19, 1972.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
